intro: Tephroseris polycephala, commonly known as the many-headed tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers that are typically clustered together. It thrives in rocky, coastal environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Tephroseris polycephala is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
